content.description: Squat start matched low on the same arching rail as Her Scar with a good but scrunchy right foot. Do a huge dead point to a rounded crimp slot. And finish by going straight up to the apex of the boulder by using left hand zeno crimp.
content.location: Same boulder as Her Scar and Elysia. If your hiking to Burn Victim on the top of the 1st main hill, it should be visible to your left.

content.description: Sit start with hands on good shelf, do a balance move up to slopey shelf, then straight up to the top.
content.location: In the Elysia zone. If you are approaching from the parking, you will pass this boulder before Elysia boulder.

content.description: Stand start. Left hand on vertical crack, right hand on small crimp (see photo). First move up to good jug in crack, then work your way up thin seam on smooth granite.
content.location: Not on the Elysia boulder, but in that boulder pile. As you approach Elysia from the parking, you will see the face to the left.

content.description: Sit Start with hands along shallow diagonal flaring crack (which is more like a long scar, hence Her Scar) to the left of Elysia. Start with right foot toed into bottom of the crack. Follow crack up while using sloped arete and then throw for the top. Follow the lip to the highest part of the boulder then mantle up. Short but VERY sweet climb.
content.location: The diagonal "crack" is on the same boulder as Elysia; which is just past 1st Problem. Easy down climb on back side of the boulder

content.description: Sit start on far right side of boulder (same start as Elysia), on huge jug rail. After first move up, trend left to shallower slots (avoiding going straight up). Continue up and left to a sloper just below the apex of the boulder and a left hand Zeno (same finish as Through the Looking Bush). Sort of an eliminate, but climbs well, worthy of the El Coriso circuit.
content.location: On the Elysia boulder. On your way to Burn Victim. Same start as Elysia.

content.description: Sit start using a right foot that may/may not be covered by bushes, climb up the 3 slots and mantel up. This boulder has great movement, for sure worth doing. It's named after the nudist film about mystic oaks.
content.location: This is one of the first few boulders you encounter. Head down the trail and instead of turning right to go toward aid hill, turn left and it is about 30 yards give/take.
